main event: Four witnesses observed a disc-shaped unidentified aerial object in Coldwater, Ohio on April 29, 1952.
interesting points: The object was cherry red hot iron in color and appeared to be 1/3 the size of a full moon., The object drifted to the northeast and disappeared at an elevation of about 30Â°., It was noted that the object drifted faster than a balloon could drift., There were reports of shifting winds from various directions at different altitudes during the sighting., The object displayed two twinkling lights on its underside.
sighted object: disc-shaped object with two blinking lights
witness description: Mr. F. and three other individuals
